page.title: 20TEMPLETON'S HISTORIC SITES.
page.content: In the 14th Century Templeton was known as Templars' Tun.The Knights Templar had a hunting lodge in the area.St.John's Church is built on the site of the Knights Templars' hospice. There is an ancient earthwork at Molleston Back.The original Narberth Castle was built by the Normans at Sentence field,which is sometimes known as "Castles".The earthen Motte still remains,surrounded by trees. The name "Sentence"and the area known as " King's Park" probably date back to the Civil War.Trees were grown for use by the Navy on Narberth Mountain in the 17th Century.The name of Wood Office is derived from this. There are many long narrow fields in Templeton dating back to the strip system in Saxon times. Templeton's derelict airfield was built during World War II.
